Figure 1a shows the simulated X-ray diffraction (XRD) profile of K 3LuSi 2O 7 and the measured XRD patterns for the K 3LuSi 2O 7: xEu 2+ ( x = 0–0.05) with different Eu 2+-doping concentrations. All diffraction peaks can be well indexed by hexagonal cell ( P6 3/ mmc), and the parameters are similar to those of K 3LuSi 2O 7 phase, confirming the successful synthesis of K 3LuSi 2O 7:Eu 2+ phosphors
33 . To further understand the phase structure and sites occupation of Eu 2+ ions, Rietveld refinement were performed for K 3LuSi 2O 7: xEu 2+ ( x = 0, 0.01, 0.02, and 0.04), as shown in Fig. 1b and Supplementary Fig. 1. All the refinements demonstrated low R-factors (Supplementary Table 1). Moreover, Supplementary Tables 2 and 3 listed the parameters of atoms’ coordinates and bond lengths of the studied phases for the comparison.
